intro: Luzula arcuata var. unalaschkensis, commonly known as the Alaska sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. This variety is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tundra or alpine environments. Luzula arcuata var. unalaschkensis is adapted to cold climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
